p: NHP carcasses were identified at species or genus level, by the Veterinary team at LZOON or by the Zoology/Mastozoology teams at UFMG, using morphological criteria [ 20– 22]. Out of 781 NHP analyzed in this study, 360 carcasses (collected in 2017) were forward to UFMG laboratories, and some of them were taxidermized and deposited in the Center of Taxonomic Collections of Universidade Federal de Minas Gerais (CCT-UFMG), Brazil [ 20– 22]. The Committee on Ethics in the Use of Animals of UFMG approved the study (CEUA 98/2017).
